issue.message: Call requires permission which may be rejected by user: code should explicitly check to see if permission is available (with `checkPermission`) or explicitly handle a potential `SecurityException`

READ_EXTERNAL_STORAGE is deprecated (and is not granted) when targeting Android 13+. If you need to query or interact with MediaStore or media files on the shared storage, you should instead use one or more new storage permissions: `READ_MEDIA_IMAGES`, `READ_MEDIA_VIDEO` or `READ_MEDIA_AUDIO`.
Consider using `apply()` instead; `commit` writes its data to persistent storage immediately, whereas `apply` will handle it in the background
Consider using `apply()` instead; `commit` writes its data to persistent storage immediately, whereas `apply` will handle it in the background
Implicitly using the default locale is a common source of bugs: Use `toUpperCase(Locale)` instead. For strings meant to be internal use `Locale.ROOT`, otherwise `Locale.getDefault()`.
Implicitly using the default locale is a common source of bugs: Use `toUpperCase(Locale)` instead. For strings meant to be internal use `Locale.ROOT`, otherwise `Locale.getDefault()`.
When targeting Android 13 or higher, posting a permission requires holding the `POST_NOTIFICATIONS` permission (usage from com.bumptech.glide.request.target.NotificationTarget)
Found dynamic locale changes, but did not find corresponding Play Core library calls for downloading languages and splitting by language is not disabled in the `bundle` configuration
Your app is currently not handling Selected Photos Access introduced in Android 14+
